emerging_technologies.name: AI-Driven Smart Contracts
emerging_technologies.description: Smart contracts that can autonomously adapt based on external data inputs and AI decision-making algorithms.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Reduces the need for intermediaries, enhances contract efficiency and adaptability, but raises concerns about AI bias and decision transparency.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Legal frameworks, trust in AI systems, and blockchain scalability improvements.

emerging_technologies.name: Blockchain-Verified Autonomous Decisions
emerging_technologies.description: Autonomous systems making decisions with blockchain for verification, ensuring accountability and transparency.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Enhances safety and reliability in autonomous operations but might increase the complexity of system oversight.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Regulatory acceptance, technological maturity of both autonomous systems and blockchain.

emerging_technologies.name: Tokenized Cognitive Enhancements
emerging_technologies.description: Cognitive enhancement through neural interfaces, where access or improvements can be tokenized.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could lead to a cognitive divide, ethical debates on human enhancement, and privacy concerns.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Ethical considerations, regulatory frameworks, and public perception of neural tech.

emerging_technologies.name: Decentralized Space Operations
emerging_technologies.description: Operational management of space activities through decentralized systems to enhance coordination and resource allocation.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Promotes international cooperation in space but could complicate jurisdiction and sovereignty issues.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: International agreements, technological feasibility, and the involvement of private entities.

mainstream_technologies.name: Decentralized Energy Grids
mainstream_technologies.description: Energy grids managed through decentralized networks where energy production and consumption are tokenized.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widely adopted in regions with advanced renewable energy infrastructure, facing regulatory and integration challenges elsewhere.

mainstream_technologies.name: Zero-Knowledge Applications
mainstream_technologies.description: Applications leveraging zero-knowledge proofs for privacy-preserving interactions and transactions.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Increasingly integrated into financial sectors, government services, and health data management for privacy compliance.

epoch_themes.description: A shift towards systems where control and decision-making are distributed rather than centralized.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Empowers individuals and smaller entities but requires new governance models and trust mechanisms.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Growing interest in blockchain, push for transparency, and the rise of autonomous technologies.

epoch_themes.description: Technological enhancements that augment human cognitive and physical capabilities.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Potential for significant improvements in human abilities but raises ethical, equality, and privacy issues.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increased investment in brain-computer interfaces, gene editing, and personalized medicine.
